subject: Re: Poe Meets Shaw is now on sale! :-)
msgSnippet: ... You re right. It would. In this case, however, I think it s more of a monitor issue instead of a browser one, as someone mentioned to me in private. For
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Ph. D." <phil@...> wrote:

> It would be useful if those with problems would state what browser > and OS they are using.

You're right. It would. In this case, however, I think it's more of a monitor issue instead of a browser one, as someone mentioned to me in private. For example, someone with a brightness and contrast setting of 100 each would have NO problems with it, unless there were some visual and/or colour blindness issues, someone having the contrast set to 1 would find it substantially more difficult. As for colour blindness, I chose the yellow for the text specifically because it seems to contrast with just about everything (except, perhaps, the spots on the page that have the light blue fireworks, hence my splitting the bottom line into 2). I've yet to hear about green/yellow colour blindness, but I suppose it could be a form of green/red.

> For me on Windows 7 and IE9, the page shows up just fine.

That's good to hear. Thanks for letting me know.
